what-it-does: Checks for unnecessary subscript reversal of iterable.
why-is-this-bad:
It's unnecessary to reverse the order of an iterable when passing it
into reversed(), set() or sorted() functions as they will change
the order of the elements again.
example:
sorted(iterable[::-1])
set(iterable[::-1])
reversed(iterable[::-1])



Use instead:


sorted(iterable)
set(iterable)
iterable
